tuv.seg: Chiropodists/podiatrists assess, diagnose and treat diseases and abnormalities of the foot and lower limb
Déanann coslia measúnú, diagnóis agus cóireáil ar ghalair agus éalang a bhaineann leis an gcos
The term 'podiatrist' is now replacing the term 'chiropodist'
Is féidir le cosliacht feabhas suntasach a chur ar chaighdeán saoil daoine trí phian a mhaolú agus soghluaisteacht a chur chun cinn agus a chothú
Podiatry can significantly improve peoples’ quality of life by alleviating painful symptoms, and promoting and maintaining mobility
Sa Bhéarla, tá an téarma ‘podiatrist’ ag teacht isteach anois in áit an téarma ‘chiropodist’

The Health Service Executive (HSE) is not legally obliged to provide chiropody/podiatry services but where they do, services may be provided by the Local Health Office or by voluntary organisations on behalf of the HSE

Níl aon dualgas dlíthiúil ar Fheidhmeannacht na Seirbhísí Sláinte (FSS)seirbhísí cosliachta a chur ar fáil ach sa chás go ndéanann siad é sin, d’fhéadfadh seirbhísí a bheith á gcur ar fáil ag an Oifig Sláinte Áitiúil nó ag eagraíochtaí deonacha thar ceann FSS

Where the service is available, it is free to medical card holders and people with Hepatitis C who contracted the disease through the use of Human Immunoglobulin-Anti-D or from the receipt within Ireland of any blood product or a blood transfusion and who have a Health Amendment Act Card

Sa chás go bhfuil an tseirbhís ar fáil, is seirbhís í atá saor in aisce i gcás daoine a bhfuil cártaí leighis acu agus daoine a tholg Heipitíteas C go díreach nó go hindíreach as glóbailin imdhíonachta frith-D daonna a úsáid nó as aon táirge fola nó aistriú fola a fuarthas in Éirinn agus a bhfuil Cárta faoin Acht Sláinte Leasaithe acu
Tax relief and chiropody services
Faoiseamh cánach agus seirbhísí cosliachta
Non-medical card holders may be able to claim tax relief on chiropody services if you are required to attend as part of medical treatment
D’fhéadfadh sé go mbeadh daoine nach bhfuil cártaí leighis acu ábalta faoiseamh cánach a éileamh ar sheirbhísí cosliachta má tá orthu freastal ar na seirbhísí sin mar chuid de chóir leighis
(That is, you have a significant disability or a serious illness, etc
(Is é sin, má tá míchumas suntasach nó tinneas tromchúiseach srl
and your doctor directs you attend chiropody services)
ort, agus go n-ordaíonn do dhochtúir duit freastal ar sheirbhísí cosliachta)
You may also be able to claim tax relief on any doctors visits and prescription drugs associated with this care. See our information on tax relief for medical expenses for further details
D’fhéadfadh sé go mbeifeá ábalta faoiseamh cánach a éileamh ar chostais sláinte ar aon chuairt dochtúra agus ar chógais ar oideas a bhaineann leis an gcúram seo freisin
Coru, the Health and Social Care Professionals Council is the organisation that will register and regulate chiropodists/podiatrists
Is iad Coru, Comhairle na nGairmithe Sláinte agus Cúraim Shóisialta an eagraíocht a dhéanfaidh coslianna a chlárú agus a rialú
Coru is currently putting in place the foundation for the establishment of the registers and the professional standards for groups covered by the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005
Tá an bunús do bhunú na gclár agus na gcaighdeán gairmiúil do ghrúpaí arna gclúdach ag an Acht um Ghairmithe Sláinte agus Cúraim Shóisialaigh 2005 á chur le chéile ag Coru i láthair na huaire
Read more about registration of social care professionals here
Léigh tuilleadh faoi chlárú na ngairmithe cúraim shóisialaigh anseo
There are currently 3 separate professional bodies representing chiropodists/podiatrists:
Tá trí chomhlacht gairmiúil ar leith ag déanamh ionadaíocht ar choslianna faoi láthair:
• The Society of Chiropodists and Podiatrists of Ireland
• Cumann Coslianna na hÉireann
• Irish Chiropodists/Podiatrists Organisation Ltd
• Irish Chiropodists/Podiatrists Organisation Ltd
• Institute of Chiropodists and Podiatrists
• Institute of Chiropodists and Podiatrists
You can contact them if you want more information about chiropody or wish to check whether your practitioner is a registered member
Is féidir leat dul i dteagmháil leo má theastaíonn tuilleadh eolais uait faoi chosliacht nó más mian leat a sheiceáil an ball cláraithe é / í do chleachtóir
Chiropody services provided by the HSE vary but usually they give priority to the following groups:
Bíonn éagsúlachtaí idir na seirbhísí cosliachta atá á gcur ar fáil ag FSS, ach is iondúil go dtugann siad tús áite do na grúpaí seo a leanas:
• Medical card holders who are aged 66 and over
• Sealbhóirí cártaí leighis atá 66 bliain d’aois nó os a chionn

• People who have contracted Hepatitis C directly or indirectly from the use of Human Immunoglobulin-Anti-D or from the receipt within Ireland of any blood product or a blood transfusion and who have Health Amendment Act Cards

• Daoine a tholg Heipitíteas C go díreach nó go hindíreach as glóbailin imdhíonachta frith-D daonna a úsáid nó as aon táirge fola nó aistriú fola a fuarthas in Éirinn agus a bhfuil cártaí faoin Acht Sláinte Leasaithe acu
• People who have illnesses such as diabetes or arthritis
• Daoine ar a bhfuil tinnis cosúil le diaibéiteas nó airtríteas
The service is usually provided at health centres or HSE clinics
Cuirtear an tseirbhís ar fáil de ghnáth ag ionaid sláinte nó ag clinicí FSS
In exceptional circumstances, it may be possible to get a chiropody service at home
I gcúinsí eisceachtúla, d’fhéadfadh sé tarlú go mbeadh seirbhís cosliachta ar fáil ag baile
Normally you are referred for chiropody services by your GP or public health nurse
Is iondúil go n-atreoraíonn do dhochtúir teaghlaigh (DG) nó d’altra sláinte poiblí tú i gcomhair seirbhísí cosliachta
You may also contact chiropodists/podiatrists directly, but you cannot claim tax relief unless the treatment is directed by a GP or hospital as part of your medical care

Is féidir leat dul i dteagmháil le coslianna go díreach freisin, ach ní féidir leat faoiseamh cánach a éileamh ach amháin má thugann DG nó ospidéal treoir go bhfuil cóireáil le cur ort mar chuid de do chúram leighis
See our information on tax relief on medical expenses for details of how to apply
Cá háit a ndéanfaidh mé iarratas
Contact your GP or public health nurse for information on chiropody services in your area
Faisnéis teagmhála dod’ oifig cánach áitiúil i gcomhair éileamh maidir le Faoiseamh cánach ar chostais leighis
